atc_classifications.help_text: Many related resources. Can be either a list of URIs or list of individually nested resource data.

level1_description.help_text: Description of first level of classification

level2_description.help_text: Description of second level of classification

level3_description.help_text: Description of third level of classification

level4_description.help_text: Description of fourth level of classification

availability_type.help_text: The availability type for the drug (0 = discontinued, 1 = prescription only, 2 = over the counter)

biotherapeutic.help_text: A single related resource. Can be either a URI or set of nested resource data.

biocomponents.help_text: Many related resources. Can be either a list of URIs or list of individually nested resource data.

component_id.help_text: Primary key. Unique identifier for each of the molecular components of biotherapeutics in ChEMBL (e.g., antibody chains, recombinant proteins, synthetic peptides).

organism.help_text: Name of the species from which the sequence is derived.

tax_id.help_text: NCBI tax ID for the species from which the sequence is derived. May be null for humanized monoclonal antibodies, synthetic peptides etc.

helm_notation.help_text: Sequence notation generated according to the HELM standard (http://www.openhelm.org/home). Currently for peptides only

black_box_warning.help_text: Indicates that the drug has a black box warning

chebi_par_id.help_text: Preferred ChEBI ID for the compound (where different from assigned)

chirality.help_text: Shows whether a drug is dosed as a racemic mixture (0), single stereoisomer (1) or is an achiral molecule (2)

cross_references.help_text: Many related resources. Can be either a list of URIs or list of individually nested resource data.

xref_id.help_text: Identifier for the entry in the cross-referenced database

xref_name.help_text: Name for the entry in the cross-referenced database, where applicable

dosed_ingredient.help_text: Indicates that the drug is dosed in this form (e.g., a particular salt)

first_approval.help_text: Earliest known approval year for the molecule

first_in_class.help_text: Indicates whether this is known to be the first compound of its class (e.g., acting on a particular target).

indication_class.help_text: Indication class(es) assigned to a drug in the USP dictionary

inorganic_flag.help_text: Indicates whether the molecule is inorganic (i.e., containing only metal atoms and <2 carbon atoms)

max_phase.help_text: Maximum phase of development reached for the compound (4 = approved). Null where max phase has not yet been assigned.

molecule_hierarchy.help_text: A single related resource. Can be either a URI or set of nested resource data.

molecule_properties.help_text: A single related resource. Can be either a URI or set of nested resource data.

cx_logd.help_text: The calculated octanol/water distribution coefficient at pH7.4 using ACDlabs v12.01

cx_logp.help_text: The calculated octanol/water partition coefficient using ACDlabs v12.01

cx_most_apka.help_text: The most acidic pKa calculated using ACDlabs v12.01

cx_most_bpka.help_text: The most basic pKa calculated using ACDlabs v12.01

full_molformula.help_text: Molecular formula for the full compound (including any salt)

full_mwt.help_text: Molecular weight of the full compound including any salts

hba_lipinski.help_text: Number of hydrogen bond acceptors calculated according to Lipinski's original rules (i.e., N + O count))

hbd_lipinski.help_text: Number of hydrogen bond donors calculated according to Lipinski's original rules (i.e., NH + OH count)

molecular_species.help_text: Indicates whether the compound is an acid/base/neutral

num_lipinski_ro5_violations.help_text: Number of violations of Lipinski's rule of five using HBA_LIPINSKI and HBD_LIPINSKI counts

num_ro5_violations.help_text: Number of violations of Lipinski's rule-of-five, using HBA and HBD definitions

qed_weighted.help_text: Weighted quantitative estimate of drug likeness (as defined by Bickerton et al., Nature Chem 2012)

ro3_pass.help_text: Indicates whether the compound passes the rule-of-three (mw < 300, logP < 3 etc)

molecule_structures.help_text: A single related resource. Can be either a URI or set of nested resource data.

canonical_smiles.help_text: Canonical smiles, generated using pipeline pilot

molfile.help_text: MDL Connection table representation of compound

standard_inchi.help_text: IUPAC standard InChI for the compound

standard_inchi_key.help_text: IUPAC standard InChI key for the compound

molecule_type.help_text: Type of molecule (Small molecule, Protein, Antibody, Oligosaccharide, Oligonucleotide, Cell, Unknown)

natural_product.help_text: Indicates whether the compound is natural product-derived (currently curated only for drugs)

oral.help_text: Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered orally.

parenteral.help_text: Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered parenterally

polymer_flag.help_text: Indicates whether a molecule is a small molecule polymer (e.g., polistyrex)

prodrug.help_text: Indicates that the molecule is a pro-drug (see molecule hierarchy for active component, where known)

structure_type.help_text: Indications whether the molecule has a small molecule structure or a protein sequence (MOL indicates an entry in the compound_structures table, SEQ indications an entry in the protein_therapeutics table, NONE indicates an entry in neither table, e.g., structure unknown)

therapeutic_flag.help_text: Indicates that a drug has a therapeutic application (as opposed to e.g., an imaging agent, additive etc).

topical.help_text: Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered topically.

usan_stem.help_text: Where the compound has been assigned a USAN name, this indicates the stem, as described in the USAN_STEM table.

usan_substem.help_text: Where the compound has been assigned a USAN name, this indicates the substem

usan_year.help_text: The year in which the application for a USAN/INN name was made

withdrawn_country.help_text: List of countries/regions where the drug has been withdrawn

withdrawn_flag.help_text: Flag indicating whether the drug has been withdrawn in at least one country (not necessarily in the US)

withdrawn_year.help_text: Year the drug was first withdrawn in any country
